intro: Parrya nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stem parrya, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, leafless stems. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in open habitats such as slopes and grasslands. Parrya nudicaulis is a low-growing perennial that is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
